full_text: Screened by NARA, 9/21/2023 15 01089 HONG KONG STATUTORY DECLARATION I,CHAN NUI (15) & )alias Ng Nui 03.00 Occupation: domestic help. Resid- ing at Arbuthnot Rd. 3/A,T/F., Central, Hongkong. Holder of the Hongkong Identity Card A051467. STAMP ou 17 111 69 8 do solemnly and sincerely declare that to the best of my knowldege information and belief I was born on 6th March, 1915 at Chor Shan, Tungkoon, Canton China. I was married to my husband Lau Chuen A1 )on 1939 at Tungkoon, Canton, China. Out of this marriage we have two sons. My son Lau Wing Kong il )also spelt as Lau Wing Kwong, alias Lau Wing Po (1.18 iB )was born on 11th June, 1940 at Hongkong and is now residing at arbuthnot Rd. ,3/A,T/F., Central, Hongkong. My sonLau Ming (Kwong pp )also spelt as Lau Ming Kwong ( of =1 )was born on 31st July, 1947 at Hongkong and is now residing at Arbuthnot Rd. 3/A, T/F. C., Hongkong. My father Chan Yiu 314 ) deceased on 1940 at Tungkoon, Canton, China. My mother Chow Si deceased on 1942 at Tungkoon, Canton, China. My brother Chan Yiu Ke l gm resides at Tungkoon, Canton, China. My hsuhand Lau Chuen resides at Arbuthnot Rd. 3/A, T/F. , C., Hongkong. I don't have any blood relationship or relationes in the United States. I have never applied a visa or other documents to enter into the United States. The last time I left the mainland China was on 1945. And I make this solemn declaration conscientiously believing the same to be true and by virtue of the provisions of the Statutory Declarations Act, 1835. Declared at the Courts of Justice, Hong Kong, this day of 17 MAR 1969 SENG KUT through the interpretation of 13& 4 KUT the said having been also first declared that he had truly, distinctly, and audibly interpreted the contents of this docu- ment to the declarant, and that he would truly and faithfully interpret the declaration about to be adminis- tered to him/her. Before me, a.R.R A Commissioner etc. WORE I, do solemnly and sincerely declare that I well understand the English and Chinese languages and that I have truly, distinctly, and audibly interpreted the contents of this document to the declarant bhan Nin and that I will truly and faithfully interpret the declaration about to be administered to him/her. Declared at the Courts of Justice, Hong Kong this day of 17 1960 9 19 Before me. acquired A Commissioner etc.
